ja50:1.1: The Bodhisatta, though an unbeliever, regularly offers flowers to a deity when he is still the crown prince. On ascending the throne, he announces that he must pay back the deity by offering a thousand evildoers in sacrifice. The bluff has the intended effect, for from that day not a single evildoer was to be found.
ja50:1.2: _Upayācita_ here has the same meaning as in Sanskrit, a promise or pledge made to propitiate a deity.
